Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Microcin H47 (MccH47, Gly-rich; metallo-AMPs, natural AMPs; class 2b microcins, bacteriocins, the siderophore-microcin family, Gram-negative bacteria, prokaryotes, BBr; BBII; XXB)
Sequence Information.Source: Escherichia coliNissle 1917,Escherichia coliH47, human microbiota:gut; , symbiont bacteria;Escherichia coliCA46,Escherichia coliCA58,Escherichia coliMC4100(pMM1.15)

Literature Information.Literature: Active against E. coli ATCC 25922 or BAA-196 or DH5alpha (MIC 1.1-5.3 uM), S. typhimurium (MIC 6.3-12.7 uM), S. flexneri 2457T or M90T (MIC 2.4-4.4 uM), and P. mirabilis (MIC 5.3 uM) (Palmer et al., 2020). MccH47 is composed of two moieties, peptide and salmochelin-like siderophore moiety. The peptide has toxic effects, while the salmochelin confers the uptake properties to the molecule. This allows E. coli K12 to tansport the peptide antibiotic into the cell via the cathchol pathway ("the catechol strategy") via the receptors Cir, Fiu, or FepA and the TobB complex. MccH47 acts on the proton channel of ATP synthase (PubMed 2003). Found in multiple species (Vassiliadis G et al. 2010). Updated 3/2014; 2/2020; 6/2023.
